website_summaries.verdict: These rails mount securely to the bowl and are a better choice for customers who may not have full use of both hands.
pros: Mounts securely to bowl with adjustable bracket
Handles are adjustable and rotate for a variety of comfortable, secure positions
Height adjusts to fit standard or elevated seats
Anodized aluminum tubing with rubber-tipped legs
cons: Cleansers, urine, and even water can pit the aluminum bracket

customer_reviews.title: The rail gave way when my 92 year old father ...
customer_reviews.text: The rail gave way when my 92 year old father was getting up from the toilet. Now he has a compound fracture in his sacral area and 2 cracked ribs. It gave way to the side, failing at the joint on one side where the spring loaded button attaches to the piece that is screwed to the back of the toilet seat. Pay more, get something sturdier. This product does not perform as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn C.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for my husband coming home from the hospital after surgery. Very easy to install. Legs lift up for cleaning underneath. I haven't noticed the wobbling other reviewers mentioned, but I'm not laid up. My husband might notice it because he's not allowed to put weight on his right leg. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: REBCON

customer_reviews.title: Unlimited number of stars.
customer_reviews.text: All the comments I've read I was like u don't know. I have found out all the comments are lies. I bought this for my mother she is 5' 1" tall. I got this anyway despite what was said. I put it on my mother's toilet and adjust it for me I'm 6'2" and if I needed it would be perfect. It is adjusted for my mom and it works perfectly for her hight and she can get up and down with it with out any struggle at all. Most I can rate this is 5 stars. Trust me there isn't a number for how many stars I would rate this.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Carrington

customer_reviews.title: Does wobble, but will hold up safely, IMHO
customer_reviews.text: Ripping the idea off a high dollar version, I used screw clamps and an old door security brace to get more stability, it doesnt absolutely need it, but my mom gets the best effort always. For under $30, it does the job, esp. if your pressed for time. Shown on an a older 3 gallon flush tank Kohler toilet. For $60 more but most likely no wobble, i would go with a 4-leg, like PCP Raised Toilet Seat and Safety Frame (Two-in-One) Only 4 star since "ineligible for return" on a toilet item is not called out in the description.
customer_reviews.author: fedgovguy

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Great for safety!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install! Safe for anyone who needs an extra hand getting up. Bought one for my grandmas and my moms. Installed them in under 5 min each.
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: SENIOR SOLUTION: Safety Rails + Hinged Seat Riser + Bidet toilet seat  – see photo!
customer_reviews.text: Senior Solution: Medline Toilet Safety Rails + Carex Elongated Hinged Toilet Seat Riser+ Brondell S1000-EW Swash 1000 Bidet toilet seat. 1. Carex riser allows easy cleaning of the toilet bowl, no need to un-bolt the riser just flips it up! 2. Medline Toilet Safety Rails, attach to the seat bolts, provide excellent support and rotate upwards to clean floor without detachment. 3. Brondell S1000-EW Swash 1000 bidet attaches on top of hinged toilet seat riser, replacing the toilet seat. One button detaches bidet to access hinged riser. Additional hardware required: 2 - 6” x 3/8” flat-head bolts and vinyl nuts. NOTE: FLAT HEAD BOLTS ARE A MUST Tags: install, installation, connection, clean, fit, attach, problem, bolts, hardware
customer_reviews.author: Eric A

customer_reviews.title: No Returns- Didn’t work with My Toiley
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today after realizing last minute I would need it after my surgery today. It doesn’t connect for my toilet. Husband is extremely handy and could not make it work. Thankfully I had a walker and was able to use that and a bar to help sit and the face that I also purchased a 5” toilet seat raiser. Just call d amazing to return the railings and the Manufacturer does not take returns even though not used. Amazon Elias fantastic and gave me a refund and told me to donate this item. I will donate to the church after 2 weeks when I can leave my house I’d buy a different item if you need it
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: It does bolt to the back of the toilet easily, and is very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is SO FLIMSY. It does bolt to the back of the toilet easily, and is very easy to assemble, but it's so flimsy -- you try to push yourself up and your arms are shaking a good 3 inches either way. It will eventually bend, but I had several people try it to see if it was me, and they all were appalled. I don't want to send it back because it's already been bolted to the toilet. Gross.
customer_reviews.author: AvidShopper333

customer_reviews.title: No more falls and easy up and down!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother has dementia. It has been horrible over the last year with her personal hygiene habits. So recently we got taller toilets and added these bars to the new toilets. Even though my mom is only 4 foot 9 inches tall, the difference is like night and day!! She no longer struggles with her bathroom duties. She is stable getting up and down. She is much happier. As are we that take care of her!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alison A

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Compare to the handles that are attached to the handicap toilet, this is an upgrade. I feel this is best fit for my toilet. It feels that its sturdier and taller for my 96yr old grandfather. With some adjusting to the toilet and his height im confident him using it.
customer_reviews.author: MONICA 💚

customer_reviews.title: Been in Use over 8 months
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this I wasn't planning on it being used as long as it has been needed. Spouse still uses it every day and it has held up nicely. I would recommend it for short or long term use, no problems with it at all. Provides both the sturdy support needed after surgery right through physical therapy which is where we are now and light support is needed. Easy to clean and will store nicely once folded and put away in case we need it again.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Toilet Safety Rails/Handles
customer_reviews.text: These handles were so needed and glad to have after my knee replacement! Definitely helps getting up and provide stability when sitting down on the toilet. Having them far outweighs the negative --> The only negative thing is that because these handles are screwed into the toilet seat retainer holes with the toilet seat, you cannot really deep clean except to saturate the plate that holds the rails in place. I did disassemble once but otherwise I just saturated the plate and screws with cleaner and wiped it down (I have a removable toilet seat so screws stay in place).
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Definitely glad we bought
customer_reviews.text: I have a long narrow bathroom with the toilet at the end. Mom needed this to be able to get off the wheelchair during recovery. Mounted right side only, since the left one would block access. Took 5 min. to mount. Undid screws on toilet seat, mounted bracket, put screws back in. Yeah, it's a little wobbly but not so much so that there is a chance of falling. Have had on for 2 weeks now, and it has been a Godsend. Will install both sides when she goes back to her apt. in Assisted Living. Definitely glad we bought.
customer_reviews.author: Charisma501

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!
customer_reviews.text: These safety rails are useless. The side rails screw together. There is a compression ring on each side to hold the rails solidly together. Great idea except that the threads on the rails are not long enough. The retaining rings cannot be tightened enough to actually compress the compression rings. The side rails remain loose and woobly. No person concerned about falling would ever trust them. I returned the first toilet safety rails I got. The replacement rails had the same problem. I finally bought a standalone toilet rail from Medmobile. What Medline sells is junk.
customer_reviews.author: bears and blackhawks

customer_reviews.title: Be warned. Not a safety item.
customer_reviews.text: Very wobbly legs, unstable, disconnected from toilet. I used it after having knee surgery. After the first day of use it was clear this is not a product to be used for safety in the bathroom. I would not recommend. I ordered different rails after one day of use and I am glad I did because after one week of use the LEGS BENT! I must say that I was not putting weight on the rails because I did not trust them so I was shocked when the bent so easily. Very low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not much lateral stability.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay for someone who just needs a bit of assistance getting up and down. However, there's not much lateral (side to side) stability for a person who has trouble maintaining balance. For what they are, they're built well but if I had it to do over, I would get something with a complete framework including some kind of cross member for the front, more like a potty chair. Seriously consider spending a little extra money for something that is more steady since using the toilet is a necessary but often risky maneuver for anyone who is even the least bit physically challenged.
customer_reviews.author: DCG/SKS

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: item NOT as described, and NOT RETURNABLE!
customer_reviews.text: The description is a lie, These are NOT adjustable. The product I received is NOT the same as in the photo. The arms are no taller than the injured person's thigh (about 4 inches taller than the toilet seat) which is NOT helpful! and the arms are not adjustable to be taller or shorter, they only adjust to fit the height of the toilet itself To add insult to injury, THESE ARE NOT RETURNABLE. So I basically just got ripped off because they sent an item that is NOT as described or pictured. Zero stars!
customer_reviews.author: BGenie

customer_reviews.title: fast and easy to install on standard toilet.
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for surgery on the lower spine. Needed help lowering to sit. This helps immensely. The height & width is adjustable, but I am very large so it is limiting somewhat. I only gave it 4 stars because even tho it fits and is tightened the legs wobble a tiny bit. I do not feel like it would collapse tho. It is cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: gee gayle!

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit a one unit commode!!!!
customer_reviews.text: With all of the new commodes that are a single unit - this should have had a disclaimer in the product information! Hubby was due home from rehab the next day and we were not prepared as this unit will not fit a one unit commode 0 it needs the separate tank and separate bowl commodes. Fortunately, it wasn't very expensive as we donated it to the thrift store.
customer_reviews.author: CristCross

customer_reviews.title: Arms too high/ not stable
customer_reviews.text: The arms are too high causing strain on the shoulder joints. The arms/legs wiggle even with the screws as tight as they will go. Very disappointed. Seems flimsy. The arms/legs come up off the floor causing the person to go backward when trying to stand. This item cannot be returned. The arms do not have foam padding as the description states.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Star On The Horizon

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous! As they are marketing a product for disabled people like myself you would think they would design it to be somewhat sturdy. This thing is so flimsy it's downright dangerous. The frame wobbles as it is very loose at ALL connection points, this lead to outward movement which bent the frame on my 3rd time using the unit, could have seriously hurt myself. Very angry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and not sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandfather who needs the extra arm support when getting on and off the toilet. Installation was fairly easy and everything looked great until I realized that I could not make it tighter and it was wobbly. Some reviews say that it's supposed to be that way but I don't get it - to me the whole point of this is for it to be sturdy so that you can use it confidently with your body weight on it. It sways side to side and is loose no matter how tight I make the screws (and following the installation instructions). If you want something that is not wobbly, look for another product.
customer_reviews.author: rowndy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good But....
customer_reviews.text: The rails are pretty good but a little wobbly even if tightened as much as possible. Keeping that in mind, she can use it safely being aware of that wiggle. One issue nearly makes these unusable - the way they're attached. Our tank isn't straight across rather it comes forward on both ends giving the tank an 'H' shape. Properly mounted with a regular toilet seat, we would not be able to attach the armatures to the bracket. She needs a seat riser so I could move the riser forward allowing the bracket to be reversed allowing it to be usable.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Cowpoke

customer_reviews.title: Functional. Might be concerned for a bigger person.
customer_reviews.text: The construction is thin pipe, but it is functional. I might be concerned if the person was bigger. The patient using this is 5’6” maybe 150lbs. You definitely have to secure it to the commode and tighten everything down. The older woman put it together herself and it was really woobly. I tightened everything down and secured it to the toilet and it was fine. Took maybe ten minutes and that was with removing the seat. The product is built well enough, but it is definitely not overbuilt.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. Thankfully I bought it from Amazon and not Medline. Medline was less than helpful when I called to tell them their product was dangerous to use due to poor quality. They would not even let me talk, kept talking over me and basically told me to call Amazon and let them deal with it. Thankfully Amazon was awesome and issued a credit and allowed me to put this item in the trash where it belongs. If you need assistance from an item like this, spend more and be safe because this item is junk.
customer_reviews.author: SUE M.

customer_reviews.title: The price was good but the stability is less than acceptable
customer_reviews.text: The price was good but the stability is less than acceptable. I've adjusted and tightened everything I could and it still wobbles when my wife uses it to stand up. She never had enough confidence to put enough weight on the rails to ease her standing. Even though more trouble I bought 16 and 32 inch wall attach rails. World of difference. Just depends how comfortable a person is in locating wall studs and doing handyman work.
customer_reviews.author: shops for wife

customer_reviews.title: Beware, this will not fit some American Standard toilets.
customer_reviews.text: The safety rail is of fair construction, not a heavy duty construction. It would not fit our "oblong seated" toilet that is a one piece toilet with the water tank, (back tank) part of the bottom. The area at seat hinge on our toilet is recessed back into bowl area, would not allow the back mount that fits under the seat hinge to fit. Amazon worked with us and we have ordered a stand alone rail system that does not affix to the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: wolfric

customer_reviews.title: Really helps getting on and off the potty when you have bad knees or weak legs.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy, just remove the toilet seat and place this to fit the metal bracket underneath the seat mount. The arms lift up so the floor can be cleaned. The arms can't take much lateral force though. I fear the tubing might snap if over stressed. It takes vertical loads just fine, so don't push the arms sideways, just down. One annoying thing, the tubing couplers get loose with time, making the arms more wobbly than is comfortable. I've tightened them by hand and they still loosen fast. Pliers work better, but I fear stripping the threads if I go too far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this along with a raised seat while recovering from hip replacement. Worked like a charm. Nice and sturdy, not at all wobbly. Even used them to break a fall once, and they held firm, helping avoid injury. However, for me they were very tall. Using them on my regular toilet, which is a handicap height, I couldn't get proper leverage. Installing the raised seat took care of this and created a perfect situation. There is a height adjustment, but only on the front, so making then shorter causes the top to be angled. That didn't seem safe.
customer_reviews.author: Karen N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for use after a spinal fusion surgery. It is fully adjustable, both in height and width. Attaches easily to the toilet, behind the seat. You do have to remove your seat to secure this. But once attached, it isn't going anywhere. I'm 150lb and used this with confidence. It isn't meant to hold all your weight, but help support it. I have had no problems with shifting, and I do not feel it will break on me. Definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TabbieFayth

customer_reviews.title: good work-around for frail person
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit fiddly to assemble. I set it up and it was a bit wobbly but our Aide made some adjustments and it is better. Despite some wobbliness it does hold up and strongly supports the user. I think it's especially good for places where grab bars are awkward to install, and this frame does not take up too much room.
customer_reviews.author: L. Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Basic unit but works fine
customer_reviews.text: The frame feels a bit rickety when you first set it up because there is no way to have a cross brace across the front, but it is actually perfectly stable and secure in use. The only issue that I had with the particular toilet I was attaching it to was that I had to buy a new toilet seat, and in particular had to search for one with short enough mounts in order for the mounting bracket for the rails to fit the available space behind the seat.
customer_reviews.author: A Real Person

customer_reviews.title: Not at all stable
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you read the FULL product description. I did not see this at the very bottom: "...Supports up to 250 lbs. Not recommended for full weight bearing." This was purchased for a 130 lb. patient recovering from a fractured pelvis. It is very shaky, and is not "...ideal for anyone with limited mobility, stability issues, or recovering from surgery." While the construction material is sturdy, once installed it is NOT. Read carefully BEFORE you buy, since it's not returnable just because you're not satisfied with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Zidlicky

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: bought for my house for someone who is now handicapped to be able to get on and off toilet with ease it works great gives him the independence he needed. very happy they are the same ones that were in his rehab center
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Broken hip altered my way of living......simple tasks became impossible. This device was super simple to assemble, easy to install and made it possible to use existing toilet with no other modifications.
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: Not for someone with balance issues
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to assemble but it isn’t sturdy at all. The feel come off the floor when my son adjusts on the toilet seat. If he falls backwards on the toilet, he grabs the arms and they come completely off the floor! It would probably work fine for someone who needs assistance getting up from the sitting position, but NOT for someone with balance issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Despenas

customer_reviews.title: No Return
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this item prior to going to the hospital. While I was in the hospital my children, not knowing what I had done, went out and purchased the same thing. When I tried to return this item I was told I could not even though the box was not even opened. Be sure when you order from Amazon that you check the policy on returns.
customer_reviews.author: SUZANNE GUIDRY

customer_reviews.title: If I can put together...anyone can...works perfect without bulk..fits nice I. Small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a few of these for my 96 yr old mother who still lives at home...I was worried about her falling in he bathrooms..I feel a lot better with these in place...we had used potty chairs in the past..but they are bulky and made her feel uncomfortable...this bracket fit the bill..you can still close the toilet lid...it’s just a nicer presentation and gives her the ability to be more independent....
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Slim lines and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This device is very stable and yet won't take up a lot of space in your bathroom. Great for small or larger rooms. Easy to put together and very stable. No finding studs to attach it to the wall or unsteadiness when you use it to sit or stand. Got this after a foot surgery left me non-weight bearing on that foot for 8 weeks. Couldn't be happier with the purchase. I very highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Drooger

customer_reviews.title: Screwholes didn't line up. Can't return the product.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't say on the webpage, but you can't return the product. After I got it, I found it doesn't attach to my toilet. Before you get this first check if your screws are on the toilet bowl side of the wall side. This product expects your screws to be on the toilet bowl side. Second, check that you can even get the screws off of your toilet. Beware that this product is non-returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: The product description says that the arm rests on this toilet safety rail are "closed cell foam". That's simply NOT true. The arm rests are a hard, molded plastic. This wasn't enough of a discrepancy to cause me to return it, but Amazon needs to up its game. This isn't the first time I've purchased a product through Amazon that didn't match the description. How hard can it be?
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Is all hardware in box
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product for my mom, She is 84 years old. She is coming home from nursing home on March 3rd 2020. When this box arrived it had no Hardware. I called the manufacturer it's going to be three days before they can contact me. She is coming home tomorrow and I need this product badly. They showed no concern. They once again told me they would get in touch with me in up to three business days. Which means I will not have the product put together for at least a week or maybe longer. This is not good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Carter

customer_reviews.title: Useful but could be more stable and better designed for shorter people in mind
customer_reviews.text: Recently had spine surgery. Helpful for getting on to and off the toiet. However, the construction, even with the joints fully tightened, is not completely solid or steady. So be careful and do not rely on it 100% for stability. I am only 136 pounds so my weight is not the issue. I am also 5' 7" tall and, even at its lowest position, the arms are uncomfortably high for me for getting off the toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: William Gutsch

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had knee replacement surgery. I am a large woman. I have a standard toilet, and I was having difficulty getting off the toilet. We ordered this item in hopes that it might help. I AM SO VERY HAPPY WITH THIS SAFETY FRAME! It has release buttons on both arms to widen the seating if more room is needed. The arms pop back into place very easily, and support my weight to help me get up. I highly recommend this product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Barb S.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SUPPORT WHEN NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use while recovering from foot surgery and a period of non-weight-bearing. Really helps to get on/off the toilet. There is some wobble from side-to-side which is why I can't give it 5 stars, but I imagine that most of these have a little bit of play from side-to-side because where a cross-brace is needed (on the front) would prevent use!
customer_reviews.author: tbird

customer_reviews.title: A Blessing
customer_reviews.text: Caring for someone with Parkinson Disease has so many challenges no one realizes until you live it . The hand rails have been very important in the stability they provide to be able to sit down with out falling back on the tank of the toilet . Before i installed them i was sure the tank would break off . I am thankful to have them in place
customer_reviews.author: Barbara C. VanBurger

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far! Pretty sturdy and adjustable to height.
customer_reviews.text: They are quite sturdy and easy to install. The only problem we faced was that the toilet seat cover that we had, had caps over the screws holding the seat in place and we could not fit the bars on with it so we went out and bought a cover that we could fit it with. They fit in our very small cubby bathroom and have worked great so far. Have been using them for just over a week. I am using them due to a hip surgery that I had just over a week ago and they work great for what is needed of them.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for after foot surgery.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend recently had foot surgery. He's having to use a knee scooter. Standing up on one leg from any seated position is extremely difficult. We quickly realized we needed to get something for the toilet. This has turned out to be a great value for the price. I was able to install it myself in about 10 minutes. It definitely allows someone the independence they deserve.
customer_reviews.author: Azile68

customer_reviews.title: Great price!!  Well made!!  Easy to install!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife just had total knee replacement surgery and these safety rails work perfectly!!!!! Well made and installed within 5 minutes after unboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product information weight limit is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is having knee replacement surgery. It arrived and the box states only good for up to 250lbs. Listing states 300lb limit. Thus we have no use for this item because I’m not allowing him to use something that doesn’t meet his weight requirements. That’s very misleading and needs to be updated. See picture.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Bad for Me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a short person with a toilet in a tight space. We fitted the apparatus into the space and I fit within it, but the rails were just too tall for me, impeding the movement of my elbows so much that I could not complete functions while seated on the toilet. Also the bolts on the seat kept the seat lid from going back all the way, so I couldn't sit back on the toilet. I'll have to get rid of this one and try a different kind. I don't want to return it after using it in my bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: marymc

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my grandma. She loved it. Very easy to assemble ...about 5 to 8 minutes fits nicely under toilet seat frame . You do not need tools but we still used a screw driver to tighten seat and avoid it moving. The grab arms do lift up so it's great for cleaning or removing out of way . Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: so it is not easily able to be removed quickly if needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom. I will say that the toilet is still accessible to anyone that needs to use it, but is bolted to the back of the toilet, so it is not easily able to be removed quickly if needed. The complaint is the device is wobbly and the hand rails are too high. The rails are at the lowest possible and still seem too high for my mom. She needs quite a bit of support so this is a big issue. Will possible return item for something better, as the price on this product wasn't very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: krissyt17

customer_reviews.title: it is much better now it was better if the used a wide ...
customer_reviews.text: it is not as secure as it should be for an elderly who cannot control himself I used a pipe to connect the bottom of the front base , it is much better now it was better if the used a wide plate instead of those rubber mount
customer_reviews.author: Majid

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned after reading a couple of poor reviews regarding product stability and people falling while using this. My wife has been using this for a couple of months and has not had any issues. It provides plenty of support. The front legs do move slightly but it should be expected as the legs are not anchored to the floor. It was easy to attach and the adjustable width is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Great safety rails for my parents
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on. You use the same bolts that hold the toilet seat on. A previous review had to go to the store to get them. Why? What was holding the seat on the toilet in the first place? No need for them to include the toilet seat bolts. Fit good, easy to adjust, works just fine. I got this one because of the lower profile handles. Some others looked to be higher. This one is the right height for both my wife and me. My only complaint is that my toilet back has an upward curve to it. The mounting flange is flat. I wish it had a little up curve too. Still, good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: sandy hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say to use screws used to hold toilet seat on to attach to toilet, but the holes on these safety rails were far larger than the heads on the screws so had to insert them upside down as nuts were bigger than the heads. Works... once fully installed it is sturdy, but have to make sure everything is very tight!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Leos

customer_reviews.title: No very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased for my Dad. The item came a day early. Was installed the same day. But the toilet side rail is not stable. It moves some. We removed it right away because we did not feel like it was safe to use. I would not recommend purchasing it. It is a non refundable item. Visit your local durable medical supply please. I am sure they have a more stable item to keep your love one safe.
customer_reviews.author: penderkid

customer_reviews.title: I did remove a star for stbility. It does tent to wobble just a little. Not much
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't affect the performance though. It's stable where it counts. Combined with the riser i finally have something to push myself up. I had nothing to grab on to. The sink is a pedestal, no vanity, and out of reach. It's also a half bath, no tub. This made ALL the difference! I even have arm rests!
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Electronics

customer_reviews.title: Great Safety Device
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful safety device for the elderly while taking care of business. It's sturdy but has some wobbliness as it's only attached with the toilet seat. But it is sturdy enough for the elder to simply sit straight down and stand straight up. The weight adds to the sturdiness. Otherwise, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install. Adjustable legs means arm rails can be ...
customer_reviews.text: rickety. extremely wobbly. Very easy install. Adjustable legs means arm rails can be set right for user. Strong enough to bear weight as user pushes off to get up or sit down BUT wobbles side to side severely. User loses confidence to put full weight on it. A horizontal cross brace near the bottom of the legs would fix it. Off to hardware store but shame I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I got this cause I broke my leg and physical therapist recommended this. I ordered it and by the time I got out of the hospital, it was home. My husband installed it and I'm so grateful to have it. Very useful to help me balance.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like the one I paid twice the price for at ...
customer_reviews.text: Product came within 3-4 days of order. Exactly like the one I paid twice the price for at Walgreens. I had knee surgery and found I didn't need a raised toilet seat but definitely needed rails to lift myself. These safety rails have been a life saver. Since they anchor to the toilet, they are more stable than free standing rails. Definitely a beneficial purchase for anyone who needs temporary help using existing toilets in the home. Think ahead and order this product prior to surgery and you'll have it when you come home from the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Dale K

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This item is not easy for elderly handicapped people to install as indicted by the website. I never tried installing it, but Amazon will not take it back. Amazon just lost a longtime customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Hand Rails
customer_reviews.text: I'm almost 5'8" tall and found out the hand rails are too tall for me, even at the lowest level on the legs and I am having to reach behind me quite a bit to stand up because the hand rails are too short and do not adjust for length. This is going bye-bye.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in the Sixties

customer_reviews.title: Best money we ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: Sad I did order sooner. (Another thing I can add to my guilt list.) This mobility item has been a game-changer in our household. We added a mother-in-law apartment to our home 8-years ago. I’ve been her caregiver ever since. She had a recent surgery and home health suggested we order.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Serves the Purpose, but...
customer_reviews.text: Serves the purpose, but the arms only adjust up on the front legs but not on the back supports, which raises the front only, making the arms uneven. Also, one must use both arms when using it for support at all times, or it feels quite unstable. We worry that the elder it was bought for will fall if she uses only one side to steady herself when moving around in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffo

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, helps the person I bought it for in getting down onto seat but the hand holds are too high to help her get up afterwards. There is another toilet rail set I saw that has adjustments at the top and bottom. This one only has them at the bottom. It's set as low as it can go so it will have to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: James Prevott

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This toilet safety rail fits easily over several kinds of toilets. It works wonderfully for me and I really needed the assist after getting a total hip replacement. I am 140mlbs so I am not sure how it would work for a large man or woman, but it works well for me. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Booker T

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Took a little time to figure out how to put together, but once I did it was very easy. My mother needed assistance getting up and down and this worked very well. Remember to unscrew the tabs on the original toilet seat to slid frame in between the bowl and the seat. Not sure why, but it took me a while to figure it out, but once I did assembly was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jaki

customer_reviews.title: Safety Rails too high
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid design but the safety rails are too high for a small adult. Shoulders need to be protected when pushing up from the toilet and the top of the rail, even at the lowest setting, is way too high. Since getting up is harder than sitting down I think the height of the rail should be much lower.
customer_reviews.author: L-E-T, inc. Customer Service

customer_reviews.title: I see there are 'free standing' units like this.
customer_reviews.text: product was hard to install, especially since I'm having problems with my balance and it's a little shaky but adequate for getting up from the toilet...I you're a big guy you are going to have problems while using this...even my wife complains and she's normal size. Just too tight to adequately clean up...I see there are 'free standing' units like this...I think that would have been a better choice...since they're easily removed for other people to use the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: David Umanoff

customer_reviews.title: SO helpful!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a surgery with an incision running from his neck past his navel. It was very difficult for him to get up and down from the toilet, and these handles made things so much easier for him until he got some strength back.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Lady

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit newer one piece toilets
customer_reviews.text: I have a new comfort height toilet for my elderly father. Nice, but expensive toilet. I wanted to add in these rails to help him out but the space from where the holes to connect it to the toilet and where the tank begins is too wide. I angled it and tried it that way but the parts holding the toilet seat gave way. Now the toilet seat is not attached to the toilet. If they made the back part thinner from the hole to the back of the plate, it would fit and work nicely. This is useless for these newer toilets the way it is designed now. Probably works fine for older toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M.

customer_reviews.title: Great. Just ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.text: This works so well. I just had surgery for a broken thigh bone, and am in a wheel chair for now. So this gives me the support I need to use the loo. And it does not hinder clean up. I have just ordered a second one. The one I ordered for my second bathroom hurt my hands. This has ROUNDED FRONT OF HANDLES and they are SOFTER, BUT FIRM and COMFORTABLE. No pain in my hands now, which started from using a walker for 4 months. This is the BEST ONE bar none. THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Dollymop22

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: It was surprising lightweight but EASY to assemble for me and it's strong to hold up my 200 lb. client! I don't know what we would do without it AND the toilet riser we have in place. It's also easy to clean under the rubber grips as they lift up easily. It's gotten a lot of wear and yet is like new! I've never been disappointed with it NOR the toilet riser that I bought in 2018, Yunga Tart Raised Toilet Seat.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P.

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with Convex Toilet Tanks
customer_reviews.text: Product does not mention the amount of clearance between your toilet seat mounting brackets and the tank that are required - nor does it mention that it is incompatible with a convex shaped toilet tank. Because of the product's nature, it is ineligible for returns according to Amazon's policies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Little Support For The Occasion
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy. The wife injured a knee so this has assisted her in sitting and rising to the occasion without impeding the use of the commode. It was chosen over another model as it rests on the floor for greater stability instead of just the commode itself.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional overnight guests
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s fine. More suitable if you have elderly or disabled guests occasionally. It creaks a lot. I can tell when my mom is trying to get off the toilet by the noises. We’ve finally just installed grab bars, which are more appropriate for a long term solution.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: This was an excellent product. I installed these after my wife's knee ...
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent product. I installed these after my wife's knee replacement surgery in January. They were a really big help for her and I can't imagine how she would have done without them. She is finally making goog progress so I will be removing them in the next few week ans storing for her second knee replacement. Great design/ product!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Mack

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver after knee surgery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother to use after her knee surgery. It was an absolute lifesaver. If you have a family member going through this or you are yourself, truly get one of these. I am so thankful for it and so is my mother. It has made her more independent and saved her the embarrassment of having someone help her off of the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Nanato6

customer_reviews.title: Leg saver
customer_reviews.text: I broke my leg, and didn’t realize how low my toilet was until I had to get up from one using only one leg. These railings were life-savers. If your bathroom is larger than mine, you can even move them out of the way if persons with the use of both legs your toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Cadeau's mom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't feel stable but it is
customer_reviews.text: In reading the other reviews, I have to agree--this really doesn't feel stable when using but it is. Had to get it for knee surgery and having had that type of surgery before knew I needed something to help me off the toilet. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: A must have great well built product for elderly.
customer_reviews.text: Shop online for a great price. This has cushioned arm rests,rubber on leg bottoms for good floor grip for easy getting on and off for my eldery mom who fell twice getting up before I installed this .Easy adjustable height to fit any, and easy install, just bolts under the seat on the two existing bolts.Suggest this for any elderly person, a cane is just not even comparable to this. An elderly home, right at home.This and a few other products for other use, she is basically independant now even though I am right here to help. Always buy through Amazon, cheapest prices, 100% guaranteed replace or return for credit any reason, and they pay return shipping and schedule pickup
customer_reviews.author: TAKER

customer_reviews.title: Effective and safe - great solution of periodic Guests !!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. Can be easily removed when not needed. A little wobbly when leveraging during use but this does old the weight. Effective solution for period guest that needed bathroom assistance without having to use screws or mounts things to your wall.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good for stability in the bathroom toilet area
customer_reviews.text: Safety rails were easy to put together however I had to find someone to attach them to the toilet. Once in they were very stable and helpful for my brother who had a stroke by allowing him to lift himself off the toilet by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Didnt use. Cant return
customer_reviews.text: I am sure this works, but borrowed one that has a seat and rails. Lowered it to go right above toilet. This one you have to take apart your toilet to install. Only needed it temp for after hip replacement not permanently. Cant return this. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Daveen Munn

customer_reviews.title: Block toilet paper holder
customer_reviews.text: We have an in the wall toilet paper holder. I didn't think of that before I bought these but the arm is directly in front of it so you can't have it on the toilet and actually use the toilet paper. Beware that these are not returnable so measure 10x before buying!
customer_reviews.author: CarrotTail

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly broke after year
customer_reviews.text: Reviews just not accurate, i seriously dont know why 41/2 stars review but own several toilet rails but this one has poor design very wobbly even when I tighten it up.the screws that screw from the base broke and then left tab that adjust the height even broke. See pictures for refference.i dont usually do review but they should not be selling this kind quality specially to people that are senior and disable
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Alcantara

customer_reviews.title: sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my wife after knee surgery. make sure it will fit your toilet. it worked with one, but not the other. the Kholer one piece has a curve to it that this cannot accommodate. the legs wobble a bit. but it seems sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice
customer_reviews.text: My husband did not feel secure using this Safety rail. It was too wobbly and it scared him unless someone was in the bathroom with him.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Some of the things that might be valuable
customer_reviews.text: This was not a hard product to put together. A little wobbly, if that is a word but facing a hip replacement next month for the price, I feel the best bet. Easy to clean and sanitize.
customer_reviews.author: Coop from T-Town

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Not the strongest of units available, but this unit does serve it's purpose. You can hold onto the handles for stability when needed. Easy to assemble but it is a little tight fitting for toilets that are one piece units. The clamp and pole is too close to the back of the toilet to be a 100% perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jung

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandmother to use after a surgery to help her get up easier. My mom installed it really easy and had no problems. It’s holding up great so far with 300+ lbs weight being placed on it. I was a little worried this wouldn’t hold up for her but it is without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to potty seats after knee surgery
customer_reviews.text: No terribly easy to install but a good alternative to the potty chairs. We hVe newer toilets which are a bit higher. My husband needed support after a knee replacement. He did not like the potty seats. Good solution.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: It works fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: The toilet safety rails work fine for me . I don't need much help. I'm not sure if you were heavy and needed to push down hard they would stand up. I would have preferred to have them lower than the minimum they have.
customer_reviews.author: Henry H. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Makes Life easier
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of medical issues and pain is a major issue. Getting off the toilet was a major issue. Now with these rails it is a breeze. You can adjust each rail to the height you want and they are pretty stable.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Helpful toilet bar
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job helping my 92 year old mother get up & down. Had new toilet installed which was taller & I thought that would be helpful for my mom. She still had a problem. My son installed in less than 10 minutes & she really says it’s easier for her to get down & up.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Makes getting up from toilet easier.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I broke my wrist a year ago. Wrist is mended but I still use it as support, as do my grandchildren. Only complaint is that it's somewhat difficult to clean around the part attached to toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Harrysmom

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all toilets
customer_reviews.text: It does not fit all toilets. We have a eco toilet from home depot and it barely fits bcuz of the curve to the backside of the toilet. With sum rigging we were able to get it installed. Works great and the mother in law likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Mauck

product_meta.title: Medline Toilet Safety Rails, Safety Frame for Toilet with Easy Installation, Height Adjustable Legs, Bathroom Safety
product_meta.description: Handles are adjustable and rotate back to allow a wide range of comfortable and secure positions. Closed cell foam armrests provide a comfortable, sure grip. Adjustable height 26-31(66-74cm) accommodates standard or elevated Toilet seats. Easy to clean aluminum frame mounts securely onto bowl with adjustable bracket 18-24(46-61cm). height adjustment armrest to floor: 26-31(66-74cm); width adjustment between armrests: 8-24(46-61cm); overall depth: arm 16.75(43Cm), at leg 12(30cm); weight capacity 300lbs(1136kg).
feature_bullets: Handles are adjustable and rotate back to allow a wide range of comfortable and secure positions
Toilet rail with closed cell foam armrests provide a comfortable, secure grip | Great for elderly or adults post surgery
Toilet safety frame adjusts in height from 26 to 31 inches to accommodate standard or elevated toilet seats | tool free assembly
Easy to clean aluminum frame mounts securely onto bowl with adjustable bracket 18 to 24 inches
Width adjustment between armrests: 8" - 24" | Overall depth: arm 16.75", at leg 12" | weight capacity: 300lbs
Commode compatibility: fits all standard sized toilets.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
